name: Reference - CAR-2021-01-004: Unusual Child Process for Spoolsv.Exe or Connhost.Exe - MITRE
x_kb_abstract: After gaining initial access to a system, threat actors attempt to escalate privileges as they may be operating within a lower privileged process which does not allow them to access protected information or carry out tasks which require higher permissions. A common way of escalating privileges in a system is by externally invoking and exploiting spoolsv or connhost executables, both of which are legitimate Windows applications. This query searches for an invocation of either of these executables by a user, thus alerting us of any potentially malicious activity.
x_kb_reference_title: CAR-2021-01-004: Unusual Child Process for Spoolsv.Exe or Connhost.Exe
